title: Selected Projects
text:
1. Gender Disparities in Labor Force Analysis (2024)
Research Paper PPT Website

Labor Market Analytics Research Project | September 2025 â€“ December 2025

Analyzed Lightcast and FRED data in Python, applying regression and ML models to forecast 2024 labor-market trends
Built visualizations to assess skill demand, salary patterns, geographic variation, and gender-based differences across U.S. markets
Synthesized model results with academic research to deliver actionable insights on hiring behavior and gender disparities




2. Bangladesh Garment Industry: Health and Environmental Impacts
Research Paper

Economics Seminar Research Paper | January 2021 â€“ March 2021

Conducted a literature review on short- and long-term effects of Bangladeshâ€™s garment industry on health and environment
Examined workersâ€™ health, safety evaluations, and child labor issues using historical data
Proposed strategies to mitigate risks while supporting sustainable industry growth

title: Nhat Tran
text:
Iâ€™m a Business Analytics graduate student at Boston University, with hands-on experience in macro research, financial analytics, and data-driven decision-making. My academic foundation in finance and economics from Drexel University helps me bridge quantitative analysis with practical business insight.
I specialize in:

Designing automated workflows for efficient, reproducible analytics
Building predictive and explanatory models
Transforming complex datasets into clear, actionable insights
Supporting business and investment decisions with evidence-based recommendations

Feel free to explore the site to learn more about my work, projects, and professional experience.
